add-command.md.description: Guide for creating new slash commands

ask.md.description: Request team review and approval - for complex changes needing discussion (OK fine, traditional PRs still have their place - Cursor)

beepboop.md.description: Communicate AI-generated content with transparent attribution

busycommit.md.description: Create multiple atomic git commits, one logical change at a time

commit.md.description: Create a git commit following project standards

cycle.md.description: Execute complete TDD cycle - Red, Green, and Refactor phases in sequence

gap.md.description: Analyze conversation context for unaddressed items and gaps

green.md.description: Execute TDD Green Phase - write minimal implementation to pass the failing test

issue.md.description: Analyze GitHub issue and create TDD implementation plan

plan.md.description: Create implementation plan from feature/requirement with PRD-style discovery and TDD acceptance criteria

red.md.description: Execute TDD Red Phase - write ONE failing test

refactor.md.description: Execute TDD Refactor Phase - improve code structure while keeping tests green

ship.md.description: Ship code directly to main - for small, obvious changes that don't need review (Cursor's modern alternative to PRs)

show.md.description: Show code to team with auto-merge - for changes that should be visible but don't need approval (Cursor's modern workflow)

spike.md.description: Execute TDD Spike Phase - exploratory coding to understand problem space before TDD

summarize.md.description: Summarize conversation progress and next steps

tdd.md.description: Remind agent about TDD approach and continue conversation

worktree-add.md.description: Add a new git worktree from branch name or GitHub issue URL, copy settings, install deps, and open in current IDE

worktree-cleanup.md.description: Clean up merged worktrees by verifying PR/issue status, consolidating settings, and removing stale worktrees
